reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Very clean and it felt safe.
reviews.title: Lombard lacks luster

reviews.text: On the last block towards Van ness which makes it very close to Fishermens Wharf and all touristy stuff.
reviews.title: Very Nice no frills hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Will Return
It was OK
reviews.text: We requested a room towards the back and got one. More quiet then our B&B in Sonoma.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Lombard Inn. It is a great value for the price. Parking is free, the location is great. You can walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero easily. The crooked Lombard street is three blocks away.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: The Inn is by no means glamorous, but it is clean, quiet(the walls are so thick, we never heard any of our neighbors talk, watch tv, flush the toilet,,etc. Lombard is a noisy thoroughfare, but we enjoyed seeing and hearing the city life. We came to SF to be out and explore, not stay at the hotel. If you are looking for a convienent, clean, quiet place, this is it. If you are looking for spa service, room service go somewhere else.
reviews.title: One word-disgusting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thought this was going to be a great value for SF, but i was wrong. It would have been worth it to pay a little extra for anything else! The hotel facade was old and needed major updates, but that didn't both me too much. The rooms were terribly small, the TV was broken, the green carpet had stains on it, the blanket had mysterious stains on it, and the bathroom was atrocious. Hair on the floor, nasty sink, I didn't want to step foot in it, but had to. The staff was rude, their "complimentary breakfast" consisted of powered tang and powered milk. The heater didn't work, and I fought with the front desk clerk to get another (clean) blanket, and the manager finally stepped in and personally gave one to me. I can't beleive how horrible this place was!!
reviews.title: Great location for price

likes.liked: — Within walking distance to attractions in San Francisco.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very good location for the price. It was within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf if you don't have any problem walking about 3/4 of a mile. We took a bus to the GG Bridge which picked us up only a couple blocks away ($1.50 each way). There was free parking
reviews.title: Fine Motel for the Price

reviews.text: in the garage under the hotel but there were only ten or so spaces. Luckily we arrived early enough to secure one. There was other free parking the hotel provided but I'm not sure where it was. There is not breakfast with this hotel. The room was very clean which is a major consideration with us. The hotel was quiet but there was some construction on the block behind us which started about 8:30 in the morning.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for the budget conscious with a car

reviews.text: This is by far the best combination of affordability and cleanliness in the Marina/Fisherman's Wharf area. Rooms are spacious and clean. The staff is welcoming and knowledgeable. The best part is free in and out parking, which is very hard to find in SF. Most hotels charge about $20 a day or more for parking. This place is well recommended and within walking distance of a lot of the typical attractions. Its also convenient to public transportation to downtown.
reviews.title: Price, Location, Parking, Cleanliness

reviews.text: For the price, this was a decent hotel. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Hotel has parking. Staff pretty easygoing. No common space to hang out in beyond your room, but it didn't matter much for our group.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel every year for many years. They have good sized rooms, comfortable beds,hair dryer,lanai(hawaiian for balcony), coffee machine, Tv with about 80 channels. I've always found it very accomodating. It's a few blocks away from Fort Mason a nice place to take a run or bring children to play at. I've never had any problems with this hotel and the price has always been reasonable.Right now I believe rates are 79$ till Jan 31, 2006.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
nice, helpful staff
reviews.text: our family of three stayed 3 nights in aug, 2005.
we booked on line not sure of what we where in for.
reviews.title: The only place we stay in San Francisco
Great stay for the price
reviews.text: we ended up being very pleased with the lombard motor inn.

reviews.title: loved the Lombard
reviews.text: very clean room, the most comfortable beds i have ever had in any hotel! the staff was really nice and where very helpful with a few questions we had concerning which direction we were headed when leaving the hotel. free parking which is very nice to have in s.f. we always use the public transportation. so we had our vehicle parked the whole time. we love san francisco, but we don't love driving in it! it's nice to take the bus once you are there. so many sights along the way.
